meanings.definition: A person or thing that presages or foreshadows a future event.
meanings.sent1: The old man's arrival at the village was seen as a presager of good fortune.
meanings.sent2: The black cat crossing your path is often considered a presager of bad luck.
meanings.sent3: The presager of rain turned out to be a mischievous squirrel with an umbrella.
meanings.sent4: The sudden drop in temperature was a presager of the impending snowstorm.
meanings.sent5: The howling of the wolves served as a chilling presager of danger ahead.

meanings.definition: To serve as a sign or warning of something to come.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds presagered a heavy rainstorm approaching.
meanings.sent2: The distant thunder presagered the arrival of a summer storm.
meanings.sent3: The creaking door presagered the unexpected visit of a friendly neighbor.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the forest presagered the presence of a hidden danger.
meanings.sent5: The sudden gust of wind presagered the change in weather to come.
